The slavery apology debate misses these facts.A tragic case of contradictions Slaying: A father and daughter\'s first outing alone would be their last. Police say Richard Nicolas killed 2-year-old Aja, but friends say they\'re certain he didn\'t. ', 'articles.baltimoresun.com'), ('Orioles complete sweep of Yankees with nation \\u2026', '/* Javascript deferred */var addthis_options = "digg, twitter, facebook, stumbleupon, delicious, friendfeed, buzz, slashdot, reddit, mixx, fark, linkedin, aim, google, myspace, newsvine, technorati, tumblr, typepad, wordpress, more";var addthis_exclude = "print";var addthis_pub     = "archivedigger";/* Javascript deferred */Orioles complete sweep of Yankees with nation watchingOn ESPN\'s Sunday Night Baseball, Baltimore belts three home runs in 4-2 win over New YorkJuly 01, 2013|By Eduardo A. Encina, The Baltimore SunWith the eyes of the entire baseball world fixed on Camden Yards for the first time in eight years, the Orioles didn\'t disappoint.Over the course of a 162-game season, some wins can get lost, but the Orioles\' 4-2 victory over the Yankees on Sunday night was one that will likely resonate in the hearts of fans in Baltimore for a while.For the first time since July 31, 2005, the Orioles hosted Sunday Night Baseball, ESPN\'s hand-picked weekly showcase game. And in front of a national audience, playing the only game on the schedule at the time, the burgeoning Orioles unveiled their promise \xe2\x80\x94 and power \xe2\x80\x94 to the baseball world while sweeping the struggling Yankees out of town. var adSkipCounter = 0; \xe2\x80\x9cWhen you\'ve gotten your nose bloodied as much as we have through the years,\xe2\x80\x9d Orioles manager Buck Showalter said, \xe2\x80\x9cevery opportunity to take another step toward where you want to go ...\xc2\xa0 it certainly touches your emotions."The ESPN broadcast spent most of the night highlighting the Orioles\' blossoming stars \xe2\x80\x94 first baseman Chris Davis and third baseman Manny Machado \xe2\x80\x94 and the pair did their share to write the perfect TV script.In recording their first three-game sweep of the season, the Orioles hit three solo home runs against Yankees right-hander Hiroki Kuroda \xe2\x80\x94 including Davis\' league-leading 31st of the season and Machado\'s first homer in 219 at-bats \xe2\x80\x94 in front of an announced crowd of 40,878 that included managing partner Peter Angelos watching from his suite.\xe2\x80\x9cEven before the game, when we were out there getting ready, you could kind of feel the buzz in the stadium,\xe2\x80\x9d Davis said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt did kind of have that playoff feel \xe2\x80\x93 close game, the fans were obviously in it. It was a fun atmosphere to play in. I think we kind of feed off the crowds, especially when we\xe2\x80\x99re playing a team like the Yankees because we know they travel well. And when you can hear our fans drowning out their fans, it\xe2\x80\x99s a good feeling.\xe2\x80\x9dMoments before closer Jim Johnson brought the\xc2\xa0go-ahead run to the plate and ultimately recorded the final out of the night for his 100th career save, the crowd began chanting "Sweep the Yankees." A grounder to second base ended the game, sending the Orioles to their fourth straight win and the Yankees down the steps of the visiting dugout having been dominated.Against a New York team devoid of its typical star power, the Orioles (47-36) completed a three-game home sweep of the Yankees for the first time since April 15-17, 2005. The Orioles entered the weekend just one game ahead of the Yankees for second place in the American League East standings, but Sunday\'s win sent New York (43-40) into fourth place in the division.The win also marked the Orioles\' fifth straight against the Yankees at home for the first time since Oct. 3, 1981 to June 21, 1983, when the O\'s took 10 straight from New York in Baltimore.The last time the Orioles played on Sunday Night Baseball, Kuroda tossed a complete-game shutout against the O\'s at Yankee Stadium on April 14.It wouldn\'t go as smoothly for Kuroda \xe2\x80\x94 who had allowed just nine homers in his previous 16 starts this season \xe2\x80\x94 this time.Machado, who also hit his league-leading 38th double of the season, hit his first homer since May 5 in the first inning, taking three breaking balls down in the zone before lining an elevated slider into the left-field seats for his sixth homer of the season.Machado, who had three hits on the night, recorded his 34th multi-hit game of the season.Since his callup last August, Machado has hit 13 major league homers, breaking the Orioles\' team record for the most by a player before his 21st birthday set by Boog Powell in 1961 and 1962.With his 31st homer of the season \xe2\x80\x94 a solo shot in the second inning \xe2\x80\x94 Davis broke the Orioles\' club record for most homers before the All-Star break, set by Brady Anderson in 1996 on his way to a team-record 50 homers. But after 83 games, Davis is on pace to smash that mark with 60 homers in 2013. His 31 homers are the most by the end of June since 2001, when Barry Bonds hit 39 and Luis Gonzalez had 32.Davis\' homer, his third in the past two games, came on a 2-1 sinker that the first baseman sat back on and sent the opposite way beyond the left-center field fence.Nate McLouth hit his second homer of the series, a solo shot that landed over the scoreboard in right field to give the Orioles a 3-1 lead.Orioles right-hander Chris Tillman ended June with his sixth win this month, marking the first time an O\'s pitcher won six games in one month since Rodrigo Lopez in July 2002.Despite battling a high pitch count early, Tillman (10-2) won his seventh straight decision and his sixth straight start. He entered the night carrying an 8.16 career lifetime ERA against the Yankees, but he held New York to two runs on five hits over six innings.1 | 2 |  Next     window._taboola = window._taboola || [];   _taboola.push({     mode: \'thumbnails-f\',     container: \'taboola-below-article-thumbnails---archives\',     placement: \'Below Article Thumbnails - Archives\',     target_type: \'mix\'   });  MORE:Whether a stent is needed can be tough callWhy expansion tank is needed\'Blushing\' ear is no cause for alarm7 Ways Michael Jackson Changed The WorldCivil War wasn\'t to end slavery Purposes: The South fought to defend slavery. The North\'s focus was not to end slavery but to preserve the union. The slavery apology debate misses these facts.A tragic case of contradictions Slaying: A father and daughter\'s first outing alone would be their last. Police say Richard Nicolas killed 2-year-old Aja, but friends say they\'re certain he didn\'t. ', 'articles.baltimoresun.com')]

[('Orioles strike first, trade for Cubs starter Feldman', 'Scott Feldman went 7-6 with a 3.46 ERA for the Cubs in 2013.(Photo: Benny Sieu, USA TODAY Sports)Story HighlightsScott Feldman posted a 3.46 ERA in 15 starts for the CubsHe\'ll boost an Orioles rotation that also may get Wei-Yen Chen back from injuryEmbattled reliever Pedro Strop and starter Jake Arrieta among those heading to CubsCONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMOREWith Major League Baseball\'s trade deadline less than a month away, the Baltimore Orioles made the dealing season\'s first significant acquisition Tuesday when they acquired pitcher Scott Feldman from the Chicago Cubs.The deal sent pitchers Pedro Strop and Jake Arrieta to the Cubs in exchange for Feldman and catcher Steve Clevenger. Chicago also received Baltimore\'s international signing bonus slots Nos. 3 and 4, which will help the struggling franchise pick up foreign talent.Feldman started 15 games this season in his first year with the Cubs and amassed a 7-6 record with a 3.46 earned-run average.  Before his time in the Chicago, Feldman spent eight years with the Texas Rangers and won 17 games in 2009, good for fourth in the American League. The righty was scheduled to pitch on Tuesday night in Oakland.MEET: MLB\'s most disposable commodityThe Orioles are 2 1/2 games back of Boston in the American League East and in line for a wild card berth but have the second-worst team ERA in the baseball (4.43). They recently designated starting pitcher Freddy Garcia for assignment and called up Kevin Gausman, who started games earlier in the year and has since been used as a long reliever.Feldman, 30, will make $6 million in 2013 and be eligible for free agency after the season.ALL-STAR TEAM: Will Puig make it for NL?"Our intent was to stabilize our rotation ... and we think this deal will do that," general manager Dan Duquette told the Baltimore Sun. "We had to weigh it against other factors."Strop had a letdown season in Baltimore after a breakout performance in 2012. The reliever\'s 7.25 ERA was worst on the Orioles of any pitcher with over 10 appearances. Arrieta had a 7.23 ERA in five starts for Baltimore, his last a 4 2/3-inning debacle in which he surrendered five runs and 10 hits to the Tigers. Clevenger, who went to high school in Baltimore, appeared in just eight games for the Cubs this year and recorded just one hit despite putting up gaudy numbers in Triple-A ball.NIGHTENGALE: Corbin states his caseFeldman was a valuable member of Texas Rangers playoff teams in 2010 and 2011, and his near-flawless performance in three outings of the 2011 AL Championship Series was a key to the Rangers\' six-game triumph over the Detroit Tigers.Arrieta, 27, emerged as a top prospect soon after the Orioles drafted him in the fifth round in 2007. But he struggled to maintain a spot in their rotation and instead will try to regain his prospect status with the rebuilding Cubs."Sometimes a change is (needed)," Duquette told the Sun. "This will be a fresh start for Jake and I wish him a lot of luck."CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE ', 'www.usatoday.com'), ('Cubs deal Feldman to Orioles, Marmol to Dodgers', "CHICAGO (AP) \xe2\x80\x94 The Chicago Cubs dealt starting pitcher Scott Feldman to the Baltimore Orioles on Tuesday and traded former All-Star Carlos Marmol to the Los Angeles Dodgers in exchange for veteran reliever Matt Guerrier.The Cubs got right-handed pitchers Jake Arrieta and Pedro Strop as well as two international signing bonus slots from the Orioles in exchange for Feldman and catcher Steve Clevenger.Feldman signed a one-year contract with the Cubs and went 7-6 with a 3.46 ERA in 15 starts this season. He is 46-50 with a 4.66 ERA in 219 major league games over nine seasons.Feldman was scheduled to start Tuesday night at the Oakland Athletics. Instead, lefty Chris Rusin was called up from Triple-A Iowa to take his place.Arrieta is 20-25 with a 5.46 ERA over the last four seasons with Baltimore (2010-13). Strop was 5-2 with three saves, 24 holds and a 2.44 ERA last season as the primary setup man for the Orioles. He has battled a back strain this year, going 0-3 with a 7.25 ERA. Arrieta will be assigned to Iowa while Strop is expected to report to the Cubs later this week.Guerrier is 25-33 with six saves and a 3.54 ERA over 10 seasons in the major leagues. He went 2-3 with a 4.80 ERA this season before being designated for assignment by the Dodgers on Sunday. The Cubs designated Marmol for assignment last week after he had gone 2-4 with two saves and a 5.86 ERA in 31 appearances, striking out 32 while walking 21 batters.An All-Star as a setup man in 2008, Marmol's best year as closer was 2010, when he had 38 saves in 43 chances along with 138 strikeouts and 52 walks. But fans had been booing him and management was eager to cut a deal with the Dodgers, who also acquired an international signing bonus slot.The Cubs also said they had acquired two international signing bonus slots from the Houston Astros for minor league infielder Ronald Torreyes, who batted .260 with two home runs and 25 RBI in 64 games with Double-A Tennessee this season. He was originally acquired by the Cubs with left-handed pitcher Travis Wood and outfielder Dave Sappelt from Cincinnati for left-handed pitcher Sean Marshall in 2011.Sappelt was recalled from Iowa, and outfielder Ryan Sweeney (fractured rib) was placed on the 60-day disabled list retroactive to Sunday. ", 'www.yahoo.com')]

                    });                 });             }          } })();  BOSTON \xe2\x80\x94 The best offense in the major leagues took no mercy on the San Diego Padres on Thursday, and Bud Black, the Padres\xe2\x80\x99 manager, could have seen it coming. For two nights, Black\xe2\x80\x99s pitchers had held the Boston Red Sox to a total of six runs. But they had to work hard for every out, Black said, and the Padres lost both games anyway.Before the series finale, at a steamy and sold-out Fenway Park, Black started with the basics when assessing the Red Sox lineup.\xe2\x80\x9cThe names are good,\xe2\x80\x9d he said, a subtle but revealing insight into the way the rest of baseball still sees the Red Sox. Last year\xe2\x80\x99s failed roster had good names, too, but the revamped Red Sox still start their lineup with five former All-Stars.\xe2\x80\x9cDon\xe2\x80\x99t they lead the league in pitches seen?\xe2\x80\x9d Black said. \xe2\x80\x9cThey do a really good job of swinging at strikes and taking balls.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Black was right about the statistic, and the Red Sox spent the holiday punishing the San Diego pitchers with at least one hit in every inning of an 8-2 victory. The Red Sox headed for the West Coast up four and a half games on the Baltimore Orioles in the American League East for their widest division lead since 2009. Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      The Red Sox eventually gave way to the Yankees that season and then lost in the first round of the playoffs. Photo       Jose Iglesias with a hit against the Padres on Thursday. The Red Sox had at least one hit in every inning of the 8-2 victory.  Credit             Winslow Townson/Associated Press           They have not returned, finishing in third in 2010 and 2011 and cratering last season under Bobby Valentine, but now they are 53-34 with the most victories in the majors.\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m not going to lie to you: I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t expecting to be the best team in the league right now,\xe2\x80\x9d said David Ortiz, the designated hitter, who is batting .319. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I knew we were going to be good.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Los Angeles Dodgers, of course, saved the Red Sox last August by trading for Adrian Gonzalez, Carl Crawford and Josh Beckett, absorbing some $265 million in salaries and \xe2\x80\x94 perhaps most staggering \xe2\x80\x94 giving up useful prospects in the deal. One of them, Allen Webster, worked six innings here Thursday for his first victory.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  With a chance to reset, the Red Sox invested $100 million in seven free agents without guaranteeing $40 million to any of them. Teams like the Padres can only dream of such spending, but big-market bullies like the Red Sox are rarely so disciplined.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cIt was evident in spring training that we had brought in some players that had not only had success in the past but were team players,\xe2\x80\x9d said John Farrell, the new manager. \xe2\x80\x9cThere was a clear-cut plan of what was trying to be achieved, and that was followed by targeting the right guys.\xe2\x80\x9dIn short, the Red Sox wanted good players and good people, to improve on the field and cleanse a toxic clubhouse. Their hitters tied for third in the majors last year in pitches per plate appearance (3.89), but they are even better now, at 4.06. Team chemistry, while impossible to quantify, no longer seems like a problem.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cWhen you genuinely like each other, hanging out off the field and stuff, it\xe2\x80\x99s easier to play for each other, to have each other\xe2\x80\x99s back,\xe2\x80\x9d starter John Lackey said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt definitely translates to the field.\xe2\x80\x9d Photo       Boston designated hitter David Ortiz doubled against San Diego and is batting .319.  Credit             Winslow Townson/Associated Press           Lackey\xe2\x80\x99s case highlights a trap for teams, fans and reporters. Signed for five years and $82.5 million after the 2009 season, Lackey was decent his first year and awful in 2011, when the Red Sox blew a playoff spot. He became a scapegoat, supposedly not caring enough about the rest of the team because he and others sometimes ate chicken and drank beer in the clubhouse during games.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Now Lackey ranks among the A.L.\xe2\x80\x99s top 10 in earned run average, at 2.81. He missed a year with reconstructive elbow surgery and got into better shape. Suddenly he is indispensable, and to Lackey, the transformation is not complicated.\xe2\x80\x9cFixing my elbow was probably 90 percent of it,\xe2\x80\x9d Lackey said. \xe2\x80\x9cJust working hard at the rehab and trying to come back to do the things I\xe2\x80\x99m capable of doing when I\xe2\x80\x99m healthy. I think it\xe2\x80\x99s a good point in my career where I\xe2\x80\x99m healthy and still having the ability, but being around and having some knowledge, too. It\xe2\x80\x99s a good combination.\xe2\x80\x9d [{"headline":"Sports","summary":"Get the big sports news, highlights and analysis from Times journalists, delivered to your inbox every week.","product-code":"SP","product-title":"Sports","sample-url":"http:\\/\\/www.nytimes.com\\/newsletters\\/sample\\/sports?pgtype=subscriptionspage&version=new&contentId=SP&eventName=sample&module=newsletter-sign-up"},{"headline":"Race\\/Related Newsletter","summary":"Join a deep and provocative exploration of race with New York Times journalists.","product-code":"RR","product-title":"Race Related","sample-url":"http:\\/\\/www.nytimes.com\\/newsletters\\/sample\\/race-related?pgtype=subscriptionspage&version=new&contentId=RR&eventName=sample&module=newsletter-sign-up"},{"headline":"Your Money","summary":"Every week, get tips on retirement, paying for college, credit cards and the right way to invest.","product-code":"MY","product-title":"Your Money","sample-url":"http:\\/\\/www.nytimes.com\\/newsletters\\/sample\\/your-money?pgtype=subscriptionspage&version=business&contentId=MY&eventName=sample&module=newsletter-sign-up"}]      Please verify you\'re not a robot by clicking the box. Privacy Policy    Lackey has stabilized a rotation whose ace, Clay Buchholz, is on the disabled list with a neck strain and still not throwing off a mound. The Red Sox had the best starters\xe2\x80\x99 E.R.A. in the league, 3.73, before Thursday, a testament to their comfort under Farrell, the pitching coach for their title team in 2007.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Shane Victorino, the new right fielder, said the players implicitly trust Farrell and understand their roles under him. On Wednesday, Farrell used Jonny Gomes as a pinch-hitter in the ninth inning, and Gomes homered to win the game, cradling his helmet like a football as he charged into the scrum at the plate.It was the eighth time the Red Sox had won in their final at-bat, their most before the All-Star break since 1953. Their sellout streak ended in April, and other Boston teams have had riveting story lines for much of this season. But compelling baseball is back at Fenway.\xe2\x80\x9cLast year was a bad, crazy year, but I still felt a sense of support,\xe2\x80\x9d catcher Jarrod Saltalamacchia said. \xe2\x80\x9cNobody wants to lose, and the fans are just as involved as we are. We understood where they were coming from, and we understood, as players, we had to get better.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  So they have, no matter what they might lack in gate appeal. The standings tell the important story, the best around Fenway Park in years. MAY 1                                         In Early Going, the Yankees Steal the Mets\xe2\x80\x99 Thunder             APR 28                                         Homer-Hitting Mets Can Blast, but Fail to Bloop             APR 23                                         Daniel Murphy\xe2\x80\x99s Keen Eye Bolsters a Nationals Pillar             APR 21                                         As Pirates\xe2\x80\x99 Starling Marte Begins Suspension, Mets\xe2\x80\x99 Jeurys Familia Returns             APR 19       See More \xc2\xbb       ', 'www.nytimes.com'), ('Adam Dunn lifts White Sox over Orioles - usatoday.com', 'Jul 4, 2013; Chicago, IL, USA; Chicago White Sox first baseman Adam Dunn (32) hits a walk off home run to win the game during the ninth inning against the Baltimore Orioles at U.S. Cellular Field. White Sox defeated the Orioles 3-2. Mandatory Credit: Reid Compton-USA TODAY Sports ORG XMIT: USATSI-122854 ORIG FILE ID:  20130704_jrc_bc4_021.jpg(Photo: Reid Compton, USA TODAY Sports)Story HighlightsQuintana struck out a career-high 11 in seven inningsDunn hit his 23rd home run of the yearBaltimore scored twice in the eighth off reliever Nate JonesCONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORECHICAGO (AP) \xe2\x80\x94 Adam Dunn thought pitcher Jose Quintana deserved better than another no-decision in a defeat, so he did with his bat what he had failed to do with his glove.Dunn made up for a critical eighth-inning error by hitting a solo home run in the bottom of the ninth, giving the Chicago White Sox a 3-2 victory over the Baltimore Orioles on Thursday.Dunn connected with one out against Tommy Hunter (3-2). The previous inning, Dunn misplayed a grounder by Matt Wieters, paving the way for the tying run to score and depriving Quintana of his first victory since May 21."The way Q pitched and how that inning went down, it was good any way we could to get a win," Dunn said.Quintana struck out a career-high 11 in seven innings. He allowed two hits and retired his last 13 batters.Reliever Addison Reed (2-0) wound up with the win.Dunn\'s home run was his 23rd this year. He has batted .272 in June and July after a .156 average in April and May."I think that it\'s probably a little bit of everything," he said about  his turnaround. "The things we\'ve been working on since spring training just kind of paying off now.""Like I said from Day One, I\'ve felt pretty good all year. Just wasn\'t getting any results. Now it seems like I\'m swinging at a little better pitches and putting some good wood on it," he said.Dunn also singled in a run to help Chicago take a 2-0 lead in the sixth."He\'s dangerous any time he goes up there. But again, just the quality of the at-bats is great to see," Chicago manager Robin Ventura said.Quintana was locked in from the start."The beginning of the game I felt I had really good control and I felt I\'m really going to be able to do some things," he said a translator. "That\'s s what led to me striking out so many batters."Quintana seemed as if he would get the elusive victory after the sixth. Alex Rios broke up a scoreless tie with an RBI single and Dunn followed with an RBI single off Orioles starter Zach Britton.Baltimore scored twice in the eighth off reliever Nate Jones, one on Dunn\'s error and the other on Nick Markakis\' sacrifice fly.Quintana said the no-decision didn\'t bother him. His previous strikeout high was eight, set against Texas on July 5, 2012."Those are things you can\'t control," he said. "The most important thing to me is that the team wins. The best thing that I can do for the team is give the team a quality start, give the team the opportunity to win and give a quality outing."Britton struck out three, walked one and gave up six hits over seven innings in his longest stint of the season."Both guys pitched real well," Orioles manager Buck Showalter said.  "There was only going to be a small margin of error. We were fortunate to push over a couple there out of their bullpen.""Quintana was tough. I mean, that was solid. I can see why they\'re so high on him. He\'s been pitching well for them. They\'ve got a lot of good young pitchers but Zach matched him for the most part," he said.Dunn decided the game by connecting on a curveball."It\'s a pitch you don\'t want to throw to him," Hunter said. "I would like to bury it. There were a couple righties coming up right after him."NOTES: Ventura said RHP Jake Peavy, on the disabled list since June 6, will throw Friday. Ventura said he doesn\'t expect Peavy to return from his broken rib until after the All-Star break. ... Baltimore signed South Korean LHP Jung-Hyun Yoon. He is slated to report to the Orioles\' spring training complex in Sarasota to be evaluated for assignment within their system. ... The sixth inning has become a nemesis for Britton, who had given up a .643 batting average in sixth innings coming into the contest and then allowed two more runs. ... The starting time for the White Sox-Orioles game on Sept. 7 game in Baltimore has been moved to 1:05 p.m. from 7:05 p.m. Baltimore RHP Miguel Gonzalez (6-3, 3.77) starts Friday night at New York against Ivan Nova (2-2, 4.63) of the Yankees.                     });                 });             }          } })();  There were 1,498 players picked in the 2004 amateur draft. The 1,496th was a high school slugger from Longview, Tex., named Chris Davis. The Yankees used their 50th-round choice that summer on Davis, just in case he changed his mind about attending the University of Texas.\xe2\x80\x9cThe Yankees actually sent a contract to my house,\xe2\x80\x9d Davis said Friday in the Baltimore Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 clubhouse at Yankee Stadium. \xe2\x80\x9cI was happy to be drafted, but at that point I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even close to being ready to think about pro ball. And the fact that it was the third-to-last pick wasn\xe2\x80\x99t very enticing anyway.\xe2\x80\x9dDavis, 27, has been the breakout star of the American League this season, arriving for a three-game series in the Bronx with a .327 average, 32 homers and 83 runs batted in. He has no regrets about turning down the Yankees, he said, even though he never did play for the Longhorns.After one semester at Texas, Davis enrolled at a junior college, and he signed with the Rangers two years later as a fifth-round pick. The draft lasts only 40 rounds now, and Davis said he doubted the Yankees would have stuck with him if he had struggled. Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s probably a good thing I didn\xe2\x80\x99t sign, because I think I started my professional career 1 for 32,\xe2\x80\x9d Davis said. \xe2\x80\x9cSo I might have been home quicker than I wanted to be.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Soon enough, Davis figured things out. In his first full professional season, he hit 36 homers. The next year he hit 40, including 17 for the Rangers. He also struck out prodigiously, and his reputation began to harden around the game: big power but lots of strikeouts.\xe2\x80\x9cPower\xe2\x80\x99s always been my forte,\xe2\x80\x9d Davis said. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t think there was ever a question of whether I had power. It was, was I going to be able to make contact consistently and give myself a chance to let that play?\xe2\x80\x9dThe Rangers reached the World Series in 2010 but left Davis off their roster. He had continued to thrash Class AAA pitching that season, but Mitch Moreland had supplanted him as the organization\xe2\x80\x99s major league first baseman.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The next summer, Texas traded Davis to the Orioles in a deal for reliever Koji Uehara. By then Davis had nothing more to prove at Class AAA, with a .337 average and an on-base plus slugging percentage of 1.006. The Orioles, who were on their way to their fourth last-place finish in a row, had nothing to lose by letting him play.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cHe fit the profile of what you look for in a corner guy in the American League East,\xe2\x80\x9d Manager Buck Showalter said. \xe2\x80\x9cOne thing that we can offer that a lot of clubs can\xe2\x80\x99t offer is opportunity. We were just fortunate to catch Chris at a time when he had a lot of things behind him that guys need to go through.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Davis homered for his first hit as an Oriole and batted .276 down the stretch in 2011. Last season, he hit .270 with 33 homers. This season has been otherworldly, earning him one of baseball\xe2\x80\x99s best nicknames: Crush Davis. Privacy Policy    \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve never seen a hitter have three months like he\xe2\x80\x99s had,\xe2\x80\x9d said Jim Presley, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 hitting coach. \xe2\x80\x9cNever seen anybody do it.\xe2\x80\x9dPresley mentioned Davis\xe2\x80\x99s minor league success and said his batting average should not be surprising. He said Davis had learned to swing at better pitches but that his biggest adjustment had been mental; with his spot in the lineup secure, he can afford to be more patient at the plate.Davis, who went 0 for 2 with a strikeout and a run Friday, still strikes out a lot \xe2\x80\x94 more than once per game, on average \xe2\x80\x94 but the Orioles do not mind.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cHis contact-to-damage ratio is unbelievable,\xe2\x80\x9d Presley said. \xe2\x80\x9cHe\xe2\x80\x99s going to strike out 150 times a year. You try to get it to the 130s or 120s, that\xe2\x80\x99s the goal. But you kind of live with it when you put up the numbers he\xe2\x80\x99s put up.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Those numbers average to 60 home runs over 162 games if Davis maintains this pace. Only two American Leaguers have ever hit 60 home runs in a season: Babe Ruth with 60 in 1927 and Roger Maris with 61 in 1961.Davis, the would-be Yankee, conceivably could chase those Yankee ghosts late this season.\xe2\x80\x9cSixty home runs is a lot of home runs,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t think it\xe2\x80\x99s something that you shoot for. I think once we get closer to the end of the year, if I\xe2\x80\x99m within reasonable distance, then maybe start giving it some thought.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cRight now, I mean, that\xe2\x80\x99s twice what I\xe2\x80\x99ve got now. I\xe2\x80\x99d have to have another half like I had the first half. That\xe2\x80\x99s going to be tough \xe2\x80\x94 especially down the stretch, too, when you\xe2\x80\x99re starting to run on fumes and we\xe2\x80\x99re playing more meaningful games. We\xe2\x80\x99ll see, I guess.\xe2\x80\x9dShowalter said he has sometimes caught himself marveling at Davis\xe2\x80\x99s achievements, the way a fan would. But he added that Davis has seemed grounded through his charmed season.\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve been really impressed, for a guy that hasn\xe2\x80\x99t been overly experienced at it, in how he\xe2\x80\x99s handled his success,\xe2\x80\x9d Showalter said. \xe2\x80\x9cHe asked me the other day about it, getting asked the same questions. I said, \xe2\x80\x98When you\xe2\x80\x99ve got to worry is when they quit asking.\xe2\x80\x99  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cHe said, \xe2\x80\x98Good point.\xe2\x80\x99\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9d   Correction: July 5, 2013   An earlier version of a photo caption accompanying this article misstated the result of Chris Davis\xe2\x80\x99s first plate appearance\xc2\xa0Friday. He was hit by a pitch; he did not draw a walk.                     });                 });             }          } })();  The Yankees came home Friday to open an important weekend series against a division rival, the Baltimore Orioles. But in what has become a ritual this season, the focus before the game was on rehabilitating veterans who will be in various parts of the United States this weekend, but not in the Bronx.On a day when the Yankees scored two runs in the bottom of the ninth to steal a 3-2 victory from the Orioles, they received significant and potentially positive news involving Derek Jeter, who is recovering from a twice-fractured left ankle. The Yankees announced that Jeter, their 39-year-old shortstop and captain, will begin his long-awaited minor league rehabilitation assignment Saturday night in a game with Class AAA Scranton/Wilkes-Barre.The present Yankees had trouble mustering any type of offense Friday night at Yankee Stadium, and they seemed likely to waste a stellar start from Ivan Nova. Down by 2-1 in the ninth, the Yankees loaded the bases against Jim Johnson, who started the inning by giving up a single to David Adams and muffing a soft grounder from Brett Gardner that allowed him to reach first. Ichiro Suzuki moved the runners into scoring position with a sacrifice bunt, and Johnson intentionally walked Robinson Cano to bring up Travis Hafner.It seemed a risky move for an Orioles bullpen that had already blown an American-League-leading 16 saves. For Hafner and Vernon Wells, who was batting behind Hafner, it was a chance at redemption after neither of them could push across a run with one out and the bases loaded in the fifth. Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      Johnson walked Hafner on four pitches, and Wells followed with a single through the left side of the infield to score Gardner and send the Yankees to their fifth straight win.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a great team win. What Nova did, he gave up the one home run early and was just really, really good,\xe2\x80\x9d Manager Joe Girardi said, referring to Matt Wieters\xe2\x80\x99s two-run blast in the second. \xe2\x80\x9cBut our guys just kept going at it.\xe2\x80\x9dThe rally also made Nova\xe2\x80\x99s 3-hit, 11-strikeout performance hold up. Nova, making a spot start in place of the injured Hiroki Kuroda, improved to 3-2 and lowered his earned run average 4.09 in what was the first complete game of his career.\xe2\x80\x9cI told a couple of the guys, it\xe2\x80\x99s impossible I can pitch that way and we can lose,\xe2\x80\x9d Nova said.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Before the game, the Yankees said that Jeter was expected to play at least five innings for the RailRiders. By jumping directly to Class AAA without any games at a lower minor league level, he already appears to be ahead of Alex Rodriguez in their quests to return to the Yankees, for whom neither has played a single inning this season.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Jeter has been making a steady recovery in Tampa, Fla., playing in simulated games and running the bases, and General Manager Brian Cashman did not dispute the notion that Jeter may have put himself on something of a fast track back to the major leagues.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cNormally, when we get these guys going in their rehab settings, you start them out slower,\xe2\x80\x9d Cashman said in reference to Jeter. \xe2\x80\x9cBut he\xe2\x80\x99s been doing so much live batting practice, so many simulated at-bats, that we\xe2\x80\x99ve assessed that he can jump to Scranton.\xe2\x80\x9d Photo       Derek Jeter will begin his minor league rehabilitation assignment Saturday.  Credit             Rich Schultz/Getty Images           Cashman added, \xe2\x80\x9cHe looks good.\xe2\x80\x9dStill, after a year in which injuries have piled up in astounding fashion for the Yankees, Cashman would go only so far in projecting when Jeter might actually return. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m not looking past tomorrow,\xe2\x80\x9d Cashman said. \xe2\x80\x9cLet\xe2\x80\x99s just take it step by step.\xe2\x80\x9dWhen asked what he needed to see from Jeter before being willing to write his name in at the top of the lineup, Girardi said, \xe2\x80\x9cI think he has to feel comfortable.\xe2\x80\x9d [{"headline":"Sports","summary":"Get the big sports news, highlights and analysis from Times journalists, delivered to your inbox every week.","product-code":"SP","product-title":"Sports","sample-url":"http:\\/\\/www.nytimes.com\\/newsletters\\/sample\\/sports?pgtype=subscriptionspage&version=new&contentId=SP&eventName=sample&module=newsletter-sign-up"},{"headline":"Race\\/Related Newsletter","summary":"Join a deep and provocative exploration of race with New York Times journalists.","product-code":"RR","product-title":"Race Related","sample-url":"http:\\/\\/www.nytimes.com\\/newsletters\\/sample\\/race-related?pgtype=subscriptionspage&version=new&contentId=RR&eventName=sample&module=newsletter-sign-up"},{"headline":"Your Money","summary":"Every week, get tips on retirement, paying for college, credit cards and the right way to invest.","product-code":"MY","product-title":"Your Money","sample-url":"http:\\/\\/www.nytimes.com\\/newsletters\\/sample\\/your-money?pgtype=subscriptionspage&version=business&contentId=MY&eventName=sample&module=newsletter-sign-up"}]      Please verify you\'re not a robot by clicking the box. Privacy Policy    He added: \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s being able to go back-to-back days, back-to-back-to-back days, that sort of thing. He\xe2\x80\x99d be here tomorrow if it was up to him.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The 37-year-old Rodriguez\xe2\x80\x99s plans to play in a third consecutive rehabilitation game at the Class A level were washed out Friday when rain prevented the Tampa Yankees from playing the Detroit Tigers\xe2\x80\x99 Class A team in Lakeland, Fla.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Rodriguez, who is recovering from hip surgery he had in January, played two games this week with Class A Charleston, S.C., and looked rusty, going hitless in four at-bats.He will try to play again Saturday, when Tampa plays the Brevard County Manatees.Jeter first injured his ankle in Game 1 of the American League Championship Series in October and thought he would be ready for opening day. But he fractured the ankle again in spring training, and Saturday\xe2\x80\x99s game will be his first since then.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  As with Rodriguez, once Jeter starts playing, the Yankees have 20 days to call him up or put him back on the disabled list.Girardi said he would not rule out the major league return of either player before the All-Star break, but he maintained there was no rush to bring them back.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t have any expectations because I haven\xe2\x80\x99t seen them play,\xe2\x80\x9d Girardi saidIn other injury developments \xe2\x80\x94 and there always are with this season\xe2\x80\x99s Yankees \xe2\x80\x94 Hiroki Kuroda, who remains sidelined with a hip flexor injury, threw a bullpen session before Friday\xe2\x80\x99s game. The team will assess how he feels on Saturday. There is no immediate timetable for his return.As for outfielder Curtis Granderson, who is trying to recover from a broken pinkie, Cashman said he was swimming, throwing and chasing fly balls but was still not ready to bat yet. He said it was possible Granderson could return to the Yankees by the end of July.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  And Cashman was decidedly pessimistic about the status of the injured catcher Francisco Cervelli, who has been rehabilitating a fracture to his right hand, which he sustained in late April. Cervelli, who was to be the No. 1 catcher this season, has been found to have a stress reaction in his right elbow.\xe2\x80\x9cHe\xe2\x80\x99s got a two-week timeout,\xe2\x80\x9d Cashman said. \xe2\x80\x9cObviously, this is a big setback. I don\xe2\x80\x99t know what we\xe2\x80\x99re going to get back this year. Now you\xe2\x80\x99ve got to get the arm to calm down and then get him going, and you\xe2\x80\x99re starting to run out of time.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Cashman called the current trade market for catchers \xe2\x80\x9ccompletely barren.\xe2\x80\x9d  A version of this article appears in print on July 6, 2013, on Page D5 of the New York edition with the headline: Yankees Get Comeback Win, but Most Welcome News Is Off the Field. Related Coverage          ON BASEBALL   Davis, Drafted by Yankees, Breaks Out With Orioles JULY 5, 2013             METS 12, BREWERS 5   Davis Shows Off Swing in Rousing Mets Win JULY 5, 2013              For Mets Draft Class, Dreams Didn\xe2\x80\x99t Last Long in Minors JULY 5, 2013                       ', 'www.nytimes.com'), ('Orioles: Tough Pitching Everywhere You Look - Birds Watcher', 'Like many, many Orioles fans and AL East followers, I get sick of seeing the same teams over and over \xe2\x80\x93 19 times each for the four divisional foes, equaling 76 of the 162 games. Enough! No wonder all these teams and fans hate each other!So, I never thought I\xe2\x80\x99d look forward to seeing the Orioles get to the Bronx, but after the last three days in Chicago, the change was welcomed!In this recently completed series, the White Sox three starters \xe2\x80\x93 John Danks, Hector Santiago, and Jose Quintana \xe2\x80\x93 held the Orioles to a combined 4 runs on 11 hits over 21 innings.\xc2\xa0 They also gave up but 4 walks while striking out 24. They were just that good, not that the Orioles have some awful slump falling upon them. The Quintana performance yesterday was especially impressive, as he was largely unhittable.So, I entered this evening\xe2\x80\x99s first game at NY looking forward to Ivan Nova facing the Birds. He had only started five games this season and came in with but 35 innings pitched and a 4.66 ERA. His last performance was against the O\xe2\x80\x99s on June 29 where he went 5.2 innings in relief, giving up 2 runs on 6 hits after David Phelps allowed 9 runs in 2.1 innings.Well, it turned out to be more of the same unhittable stuff from a guy having his best game of the season. Nova pitched an incredible game, going 9 innings and giving up only 2 runs on 3 hits, and striking out 11. Fortunately for the Orioles, one of those hits was a 2-run 2nd-inning Matt Wieters homer following a HBP of Chris Davis.Jul 5, 2013; Bronx, NY, USA; Baltimore Orioles starting pitcher Miguel Gonzalez (50) pitches against the New York Yankees during the first inning of a game at Yankee Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Brad Penner-USA TODAY SportsOrioles starter Miguel Gonzalez was not as sharp, though he only gave up a single 5th-inning run. Sporting an excellent split finger pitch, he however struggled with his command on pretty much everything. Miguel battles his way through so many difficult situations. In the bottom of the 5th, on a 3-0 pitch on Travis Hafner with the bases loaded after an Ichero double and intentional pass to Robinson Cano, he showed no stress. He fought his way back to get an out on a short fly to center field, with Vernon Wells then fouling out to Davis. Gonzalez\xe2\x80\x99 final line was 6 IP, 4 H, 1 R, 4 BB, 5 K \xe2\x80\xa6 and the Birds would take a tenuous 2-1 lead through 8.5 innings.Of course, even with half the regular Yankees on the DL, it remains the toughest three outs in baseball to finish a close game in New York in the ninth inning. Ugh! It is never easy. A leadoff single by David Adams was followed by an error on Jim Johnson on a bunt. A successful sacrifice by Ichero and intentional walk to Cano loaded the bases with one out. For the second time in the contest, Hafner faced a 3-0 count with the bases loaded. This time Hafner took ball four to tie the game. Next, Vernon Wells drilled the game winner through the hole at short to pull out the 3-2 comeback win for the Yanks.I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bear to watch the Twitter feed and what would be said about Jim Johnson. Gosh, another blown save and loss. I\xe2\x80\x99ll write that it crossed my mind to bring back O\xe2\x80\x99Day for the first batter in the ninth, and then use Brian Matusz for the row of lefties at the top of the order. But we all know that Buck Showalter is not going to do business that way. I wrote just two days ago that Jim Johnson is not right. I fear these blown saves could be, in retrospect, the difference-maker at the end of the season in not making the playoffs.You really should not win a game when you only get three hits, but you should get a win when you take a lead to the ninth inning.Painful, painful loss.Other Birds Watchers Observations \xe2\x80\xa6The Orioles are #13 in the AL in taking walks \xe2\x80\x93 more than 100 less than Oakland and Boston, the top two teams. It would seem that better pitch selection would benefit their already potent offence a good bit more. But the Birds are also #11 in strike outs, whereas Boston is #4 with over 100 more.The O\xe2\x80\x99s are second to Boston in team doubles, but dead last in triples with only five.Here is an interesting statistic: \xc2\xa0Batters\xe2\x80\x99 average age (weighted by AB and games played). \xc2\xa0The Orioles are the third youngest team in the AL, trailing only Houston and Kansas City. ', 'birdswatcher.com')]

                    });                 });             }          } })();  In a tumultuous 2013 season, Andy Pettitte has spent time on the disabled list, won his 250th game and set a Yankees strikeout mark, but over all, it has been a subpar year by his standard. At times, he has struggled to find his command and has even acknowledged losing the feel for his signature cutter. Worse, he has struggled to find answers.Saturday was not Pettitte\xe2\x80\x99s finest day, either, although he persevered despite early-inning trouble to pitch six and two-thirds innings and record his sixth win of the season in the Yankees\xe2\x80\x99 5-4 victory against the Baltimore Orioles in the Bronx. Mariano Rivera recorded his 29th save. The suddenly streaking Yankees have won six consecutive games.But Pettitte (6-6) left Saturday\xe2\x80\x99s game with a 4.37 earned run average, his highest since 2008.Pettitte said he could not recall going through a stretch in which \xe2\x80\x9cevery decision you make out there, you\xe2\x80\x99re feeling like it\xe2\x80\x99s not the right one.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x9cThe one good thing is that I\xe2\x80\x99ve been through so much,\xe2\x80\x9d Pettitte said. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve been through this plenty of times through my career, but you get to a point where you\xe2\x80\x99re saying, hopefully, you\xe2\x80\x99re at an age where you think you won\xe2\x80\x99t have to battle with your command or battle with certain things, and obviously I was wrong, and you\xe2\x80\x99re going to have to.\xe2\x80\x9d Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      In the first inning, Baltimore\xe2\x80\x99s Adam Jones reached base on a two-out single and Chris Davis followed with a home run just over the center-field fence on a 3-2 fastball that cut when it was not supposed to cut. Davis now has 33 home runs and 85 runs batted in, both tying career highs he reached last season. Baltimore added runs in the second and the fourth.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Yankees scored two in the second and two more in the fourth and then took the lead for good on Eduardo Nunez\xe2\x80\x99s sixth-inning single, which drove in Lyle Overbay, who almost collided at home plate with Orioles catcher Taylor Teagarden.\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s what happens when you\xe2\x80\x99re slow,\xe2\x80\x9d Overbay said of his rumble around the bases.Who could have guessed how much the Yankees would miss Nunez, who spent almost two months with a strained rib cage and was finally activated from the disabled list Saturday?Certainly there have been bigger names on the disabled list this season, but Nunez was supposed to be a key element in helping the Yankees survive without shortstop Derek Jeter, who began a rehabilitation assignment Saturday in Class AAA. Photo       The Yankees took the lead on a single by\xc2\xa0Eduardo Nunez, who missed almost two months with a strained rib cage and was finally activated from the disabled list Saturday.  Credit             Frank Franklin II/Associated Press           \xe2\x80\x9cHe\xe2\x80\x99s the guy,\xe2\x80\x9d Yankees Manager Joe Girardi said, \xe2\x80\x9cthat you touted as an everyday player for a while that had the ability to really contribute offensively, to play good defense, to steal a lot of bases and do a lot of different things. He has a lot of tools. So for him, it\xe2\x80\x99s keeping him healthy and keeping him out there.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Although a bench player, Nunez is far better than some of the infielders \xe2\x80\x94 Reid Brignac, Corban Joseph and Chris Nelson \xe2\x80\x94 the Yankees have used. On Saturday, Nunez had two hits and made several big defensive plays.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cIt was very frustrating and difficult for me,\xe2\x80\x9d Nunez said of his time on the disabled list. \xe2\x80\x9cI never had an oblique injury before. The tests would all come back negative, and I didn\xe2\x80\x99t know what was happening. And I got hurt twice, two setbacks. Sure enough, Nunez looked capable at the plate. But even Nunez seemed surprised to learn Friday that he was being recalled.\xe2\x80\x9cI was expecting to come here Tuesday or Wednesday, but next week for sure,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.Pettitte\xe2\x80\x99s final moments in the game were spent trying to maintain the Yankees\xe2\x80\x99 5-4 lead. In the seventh, Alexi Casilla reached on an infield single. Though Pettitte was nearing 100 pitches, Girardi allowed him to stay in.Pettitte first coaxed a fly-ball out from Teagarden. Casilla stole second, but then Pettitte struck out Nick Markakis.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  With the right-handed third baseman Manny Machado at the plate, Girardi summoned the right-hander Shawn Kelley.Before Kelley ended the inning by striking out Machado, Pettitte handed the ball to Girardi and began his walk to the dugout. Most of the announced crowd of 42,678 fans stood and gave him an ovation, seemingly a nod to his entire body of work rather than his uneven performance on a steamy 91-degree afternoon. Related Coverage           Mets\xe2\x80\x99 Wright Earns Start in All-Star Game JULY 6, 2013             ON BASEBALL   Yankees\xe2\x80\x99 Jeter Enjoys Visit to Mountains but Hopes for Short Stay JULY 6, 2013             BREWERS 7, METS 6   Mets\xe2\x80\x99 Marcum Returns to Site of Success, With Little Success JULY 6, 2013                       ', 'www.nytimes.com'), ('2013 MLB All Star Game: Fans vote in three Orioles as ...', ' Baseball fans (and presumably not just Baltimore ones) have voted in three Orioles to the starting lineup of the American League All-Star Team. Chris Davis earns the nod at 1B, J.J. Hardy will take the field at SS, and Adam Jones will start somewhere in the OF, probably, but not assuredly at CF. Manny Machado was also selected as a reserve. THE ORIOLES STARTERS Chris Davis, Orioles (1B) - Thesuarus.com lists 90 synonyms for the word "great". It\xe2\x80\x99s not enough for Chris Davis\xe2\x80\x99 2013 season. He leads MLB in home runs. He leads MLB in slugging percentage. He leads MLB in total bases. He\xe2\x80\x99s second in the AL in batting average, second in the AL on-base percentage, second in the AL in runs scored, second in the AL in runs batted in, and second in the AL in Baseball-Reference\xe2\x80\x99s Offensive WAR. We\xe2\x80\x99re talking about a hitter who\xe2\x80\x99s struck out 95 times (sixth highest in the AL) and still is second in the league in OBP. He was the leading All-Star vote recipient across both leagues. Given the stats and his popularity, no sane individual could have argued against his starting. It will be Davis\xe2\x80\x99 first All-Star team appearance. Adam Jones, Orioles (OF) \xe2\x80\x93 We know Adam Jones\xe2\x80\x99 flaws by heart. He swings and misses at too many breaking balls low and away. He plays too shallow. He\xe2\x80\x99s 30th in FanGraph\xe2\x80\x99s UZR American League outfielder listings. He went 182 plate appearances without a walk between May 18 and Thursday\xe2\x80\x99s night\xe2\x80\x99s free pass. But you know what? Adam Jones is really, really good. He\xe2\x80\x99s 3rd among AL outfielders for hits, 4th in SLG, 6th in batting average, and 6th in HR. Is he the best OF in the American League? No one will argue that. Is he one of the best three? Quite possibly. And with 4.2 million votes, he had two million more votes than the next most popular outfielder going into the weekend. Worthy or not, it\xe2\x80\x99s not like this was close. It will be Jones\xe2\x80\x99 third All-Star team appearance, but his first starting. J.J. Hardy, Orioles (SS) - Hardy is here because Baltimore fans are generous people and love defense. It\xe2\x80\x99s not for his batting average of .256 or his sub-.300 OBP. But oh my, that glove. Hardy ranks 2nd on the Baseball-Reference.com list for Defensive WAR, although Fangraphs has him at just 7th in UZR (their preferred measurement of defense). He has the 8th highest OBP in the AL among shortstops. But his 15 HR are more than double the next AL shortstop, and his SLG of .439 is second in the league. So, maybe chicks (and dudes) loved the long ball enough to justify clicking on Hardy. Stranger things have happened. It will be Hardy\xe2\x80\x99s second All-Star team appearance, and his first in the American League.    THE REST OF THE STARTERS Robinson Cano, Yankees (2B) \xe2\x80\x93 He doesn\xe2\x80\x99t lead AL 2B in WAR (that would be Dustin Pedroia), average (Pedroia, again), slugging (that\xe2\x80\x99s Jason Kipnis) or OPS (Kipnis, again). Fangraphs thinks he\xe2\x80\x99s the worst defensive 2B among the nine who qualify in the AL. But he\xe2\x80\x99s your AL starting 2B, beating out Dustin Pedroia handily in the fan vote for the starting nod. Based on WAR, it should have been Pedroia, based on most stats, it should have been Kipnis, but Cano it is.    Miguel Cabrera, Tigers (3B) \xe2\x80\x93 He may have falling-down range at best at the hot corner, but when you bat .361 over the first half, no one cares. Cabrera is on pace for a second AL MVP award, and if not for Chris Davis, he\xe2\x80\x99d be looking at a second Triple Crown as well. Manny Machado has more WAR (at least, when using the Baseball-Reference.com version), and is a much, much, much better fielder, but honestly, the fans got this one right. Cabrera is a generational talent with a bat in his hands. Joe Mauer, Twins (CA) \xe2\x80\x93 He\xe2\x80\x99s leading catchers in the AL in average, OBP, and WAR. His 100 hits (after Friday\xe2\x80\x99s games) are 21 more than the next catcher. FanGraphs has him as the 2nd best defensive catcher in the league. He\xe2\x80\x99s the catcher who should be starting, and the fans made it so.    David Ortiz, Red Sox (DH) \xe2\x80\x93 Only six DHs have batted enough times in the AL to qualify for leaderboards, and this wasn\xe2\x80\x99t an especially tough choice for fans. Ortiz leads in every stat category except hits, and that includes stolen bases. Seriously, he leads in AL DHs in stolen bases. (You can look it up!) He\xe2\x80\x99s putting up a typical Big Papi season, and starts the All-Star Game as a result. Mike Trout, Angels (OF) \xe2\x80\x93 He leads AL OF in average, on-base percentage, slugging, OPS and WAR. That\xe2\x80\x99s not a bad year. Defense? Not so much. dWAR hates him, though, ranking him 53rd of 54 in the AL among all players who\xe2\x80\x99ve played CF this season for even one game. He doesn\xe2\x80\x99t fare much better at FanGraphs. Among AL CF who\xe2\x80\x99ve played at least 10 innings, he\xe2\x80\x99s 33rd. But he\xe2\x80\x99s not getting elected for his defense, he\xe2\x80\x99s getting elected for his bat. Jose Bautista, Blue Jays (OF) \xe2\x80\x93 Barely edging out Nick Markakis for the starting nod (and I do mean barely), the former Oriole had become a b\xc3\xaate noir with O\xe2\x80\x99s fans for his antics toward Darren O\xe2\x80\x99Day. And let\xe2\x80\x99s get this out of the way \xe2\x80\x93 he deserves to be here. He\xe2\x80\x99s second in among AL OF in WAR (Fangraphs and B-R agree), 2nd in OPS,  3rd in SLG, 3rd in HR, and 4th in OBP. His batting average isn\xe2\x80\x99t much to write home about \xe2\x80\x93 just .267 \xe2\x80\x93 but the man gets on base and hits some homers, too. THE AMERICAN LEAGUE RESERVES Manny Machado, Orioles (3B) - He leads MLB in doubles, third among AL 3B in batting average, and while he\'s just 6th in OPS using B-R.com among AL 3B, he\'s leading the AL in WAR using B-R.com. Not shabby for someone who just turned 21 today. That\xe2\x80\x99s a long way from sending Ty Wigginton as the team\xe2\x80\x99s sole representative (and as a reserve to boot) a mere three years ago.                     });                 });             }          } })();  There have been many great myths in baseball, like Abner Doubleday inventing the game and Babe Ruth calling his shot in the World Series. Mariano Rivera throwing only one pitch is another.Rivera has carved out what will almost surely be a Hall of Fame career by predominantly throwing the cut fastball, or cutter. But ask any right-handed major league hitter who has played in the past several years, and he can verify that Rivera also throws a healthy number of two-seam fastballs.Last month, Rivera threw eight pitches to the Los Angeles Angels\xe2\x80\x99 dangerous right-handed sluggers Mike Trout and Albert Pujols in two tense at-bats. Seven of them were two-seamers, a pitch that tends to move in on right-handed hitters. Pujols struck out on three of them.As with the cutter, Rivera has had great success with the two-seamer over the past several years, including a stretch in June when he threw 25 fastballs out of 47 pitches, most of them to beefy right-handers looking for a cutter over the plate. On Sunday, Adam Jones was the one who had success with it. Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      With one out in the ninth inning, Rivera, who wore his socks to his knees in support of David Robertson\xe2\x80\x99s All-Star candidacy, threw a two-seamer to Jones. The high socks were unusual; the two-seamer was not.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  But the pitch did not get inside enough, and Jones drilled it into the center-field stands for a two-run homer that propelled the Baltimore Orioles to a 2-1 victory over the Yankees.The loss ended the Yankees\xe2\x80\x99 winning streak at six and erased a masterly performance by Hiroki Kuroda, who shook off a minor hip injury to pitch seven scoreless innings, allowing three hits.\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s difficult,\xe2\x80\x9d Rivera said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a loss. The way Kuroda was pitching, he was doing outstanding. He was great, and I thought it would be a good game to save. I don\xe2\x80\x99t think the other ones are not good to save. But this one should have been great, and I did that.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  It was the second blown save for Rivera in 31 chances this season and the 75th of his career, compared with 637 saves. It was also his first blown save at Yankee Stadium since 2011, a stretch in which he converted 41 straight opportunities here. Photo       Baltimore\xe2\x80\x99s Adam Jones (10) hit a two-run homer in the ninth inning.  Credit             Barton Silverman/The New York Times           His last blown save was May 28 against the Mets. In that game, Rivera threw cutters to the left-hander Daniel Murphy, who doubled, and then three straight two-seam fastballs to the right-handed David Wright, who singled home the tying run.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cHe\xe2\x80\x99s been throwing two-seamers to me for about five years,\xe2\x80\x9d said Vernon Wells, who had faced Rivera as a member of the Toronto Blue Jays and the Angels before joining the Yankees this year. \xe2\x80\x9cThey are both very tough pitches to hit.\xe2\x80\x9dYankees catcher Chris Stewart said he liked to call for the fastball when he noticed right-handers like Pujols looking out over the plate. According to Manager Joe Girardi, Rivera began throwing more fastballs to right-handers when teams sent up right-handed pinch-hitters to face him. You are already subscribed to this email. View all New York Times newsletters.   See Sample Manage Email Preferences Not you? Privacy Policy    The two pitches dart in opposite directions. Rivera\xe2\x80\x99s cut fastball rides from right to left, in on the hands of left-handed hitters, whose bats sometimes break when the ball hits the thin part of the handle. When he throws the two-seamer, it tends to break the other way.But location is always the key with Rivera. Ichiro Suzuki, who once homered off a cutter from Rivera when he played for Seattle, pointed out that Rivera was an expert at locating the pitch to different points in the strike zone.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Rivera\xe2\x80\x99s cutter is really four pitches, according to the Yankees\xe2\x80\x99 pitching coach, Larry Rothschild. \xe2\x80\x9cHe can throw it up and in, up and away, down and in and down and away,\xe2\x80\x9d Rothschild said. \xe2\x80\x9cIf he\xe2\x80\x99s got the two-seamer, people have to keep it in the back of their mind, too.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Even though he is regularly lauded for throwing only one pitch \xe2\x80\x94 Rivera learned the cutter in 1997 and threw it almost exclusively for the first portion of his career as a closer \xe2\x80\x94 Rivera does not go out of his way to correct that notion.\xe2\x80\x9cI love it,\xe2\x80\x9d he said with a laugh on the Yankees\xe2\x80\x99 recent trip.In the ninth inning Sunday, he threw four pitches to Manny Machado, two fastballs and then two cutters, and got Machado to ground out. To Nick Markakis, he threw two cutters and then a fastball, and Markakis singled on the 0-2 pitch. Jones saw two fastballs.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s too bad,\xe2\x80\x9d Rivera said. \xe2\x80\x9cKuroda pitched a tremendous game. We should have won that game.\xe2\x80\x9dAs for the socks, it was not superstition, Rivera said; it was his way of showing support for Robertson in his bid to win Major League Baseball\xe2\x80\x99s final vote contest to earn a spot at the All-Star Game. At first, Robertson did not know why Rivera had gone with the look. Once he figured it out, he was pleased by the gesture, even if Rivera blew a save.\xe2\x80\x9cIt was very nice that he did that for me,\xe2\x80\x9d Robertson said. \xe2\x80\x9cI really appreciate it.\xe2\x80\x9d  A version of this article appears in print on July 8, 2013, on Page D3 of the New York edition with the headline: Rare Time When Rivera\xe2\x80\x99s Second Best Isn\xe2\x80\x99t Good Enough.
